definitions.definition: ( rare ) The triangular colon (especially in context of not being able to type the actual triangular colon).
( rhetoric ) A rhetorical figure consisting of a clause which is grammatically , but not logically , complete.
( palaeography ) A clause or group of clauses written as a line, or taken as a standard of measure in ancient manuscripts or texts.

secondary_definitions: ( rare ) The triangular colon (especially in context of not being able to type the actual triangular colon).
( rhetoric ) A rhetorical figure consisting of a clause which is grammatically , but not logically , complete.
( palaeography ) A clause or group of clauses written as a line, or taken as a standard of measure in ancient manuscripts or texts.

definitions.definition: ( anatomy ) Part of the large intestine ; the final segment of the digestive system, after ( distal to) the ileum and before ( proximal to) the rectum . (Because the colon is the largest part of the large intestine (constituting most of it), it is often treated as synonymous therewith in broad or casual usage.)

main_definition: ( anatomy ) Part of the large intestine ; the final segment of the digestive system, after ( distal to) the ileum and before ( proximal to) the rectum . (Because the colon is the largest part of the large intestine (constituting most of it), it is often treated as synonymous therewith in broad or casual usage.)

definitions.definition: A European colonial settler , especially in a French colony.

secondary_definitions: A European colonial settler , especially in a French colony.
